description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6og76","text":"This is a protocol for amplifying DNA extracts via PCR using broad COI primers (Leray et al., 2013) and confirming successful amplification via gel electrophoresis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dctq1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"420j9","text":"This protocol originates with environmental DNA samples collected onto 0.22 Âµm capped Sterivex filters, e.g. through this sampling and filtration protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fc3j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8drt7","text":"Samples are then extracted, e.g. through this extracted protocol, before proceeding through the current amplification protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgncm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"13be3","text":"Acknowledgements \u0026 Attributions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8s4k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1l24c","text":"The PCR protocol is adapted from Curd et al. (2019; see Appendix 6) and the detailed first PCR protocol developed by CALeDNA (by Teia Schweizer, Emily Curd, and Rachel Meyer). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":76,"length":27},{"key":3,"offset":117,"length":7}],"data":{}},{"key":"7uarb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9l3h","text":"The gel electrophoresis protocol is adapted from an Agarose Gel Electrophoresis \u0026 Gel Visualization Protocol from the Boehm Lab (by Blythe Layton and edited by Wiley Jennings, Eily Andruszkiewicz Allan, and Winnie Zambrana), a 16S rRNA gene V4 Amplicon Sequencing Protocol from the Nelson Lab (updated by Lauren Kennedy based on the Schloss Lab V4 Protocol) and the detailed Gel Electrophoresis protocol developed by CALeDNA (by Teia Schweizer, Emily Curd, and Rachel Meyer). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":333,"length":23},{"key":5,"offset":366,"length":37},{"key":6,"offset":417,"length":7}],"data":{}},{"key":"8tvuk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dmmp","text":"We are grateful to the authors and editors of all the protocols above for creating and maintaining such helpful resources. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfs82","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":84542,"title":"Coastal Environmental DNA Sampling \u0026amp; Gravity Filtration Protocol","title_html":"Coastal Environmental DNA Sampling \u0026 Gravity Filtration Protocol","load_collapsed":false,"uri":"coastal-environmental-dna-sampling-amp-gravity-fil-cws6xehe","image":{"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m95bb4cip.jpg","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m95bb4cip.jpg","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Meghan M. Cost"],"colWidths":["133","133","124","141","121"],"data":[["Qiagen Multiplex PCR Kit","12.5 ÂµL/rxn","Qiagen (206143)","https://www.qiagen.com/us/products/discovery-and-translational-research/pcr-qpcr-dpcr/pcr-enzymes-and-kits/end-point-pcr/qiagen-multiplex-pcr-kit","315.87/kit"],["2 ÂµL mICOIintF forward primer (2 ÂµM) and 2 ÂµL jgHCO2198 reverse primer (2 ÂµM)","2.5 ÂµL of each/rxn","Integrated DNA Technologies","https://www.idtdna.com/pages/products/custom-dna-rna/dna-oligos","$52.1/one order"],["8-well tube strips","1/every 8 rxns","Fisher Scientific (AB20005)","https://www.fishersci.com/shop/products/easystrip-plus-tube-strip-ultra-clear-caps/AB2005","$295.37/250 strips"],["1.5/2 mL LoBind Eppendorf tubes (either size works; prefer 1.5 mL for storage)","Several","USA Scientific (4043-1021/4043-1048)","https://www.usascientific.com/dna-lobind-microcentrifuge-tubes/p/DNA-LB-Micro-Tubes","$38.95/250 tubes"]],"guid":"70298A7025AB11EEA7F38338F0D8840F","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Qiagen Multiplex PCR Kit","12.5 ÂµL/rxn","Qiagen (206143)","https://www.qiagen.com/us/products/discovery-and-translational-research/pcr-qpcr-dpcr/pcr-enzymes-and-kits/end-point-pcr/qiagen-multiplex-pcr-kit","315.87/kit"],["2 ÂµL mICOIintF forward primer (2 ÂµM) and 2 ÂµL jgHCO2198 reverse primer (2 ÂµM)","2.5 ÂµL of each/rxn","Integrated DNA Technologies","https://www.idtdna.com/pages/products/custom-dna-rna/dna-oligos","$52.1/one order"],["8-well tube strips","1/every 8 rxns","Fisher Scientific (AB20005)","https://www.fishersci.com/shop/products/easystrip-plus-tube-strip-ultra-clear-caps/AB2005","$295.37/250 strips"],["1.5/2 mL LoBind Eppendorf tubes (either size works; prefer 1.5 mL for storage)","Several","USA Scientific (4043-1021/4043-1048)","https://www.usascientific.com/dna-lobind-microcentrifuge-tubes/p/DNA-LB-Micro-Tubes","$38.95/250 tubes"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":40,"offset":111}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2tn4n","text":"IDT spec sheets for primers are attached to this protocol. Primers were ordered with the overhang specified by Georgia Genomics and Bioinformatics Core, where samples are ultimately sequenced. Core primer sequences used are:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"353ih","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8tmb5","text":"mlCOIintF: GGWACWGGWTGAACWGTWTAYCCYCC\njgHCO2198: TAIACYTCIGGRTGICCRAARAAYCA","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"529C9EF125AD11EEA7F38338F0D8840F","url":"https://dna.uga.edu/microbiome-service/"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}},"4":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Material","Amount Needed","Source","Link","Approx. Cost"],"colWidths":["117","151","133","122","127"],"data":[["Agarose","1.9 g/gel","Variable","NA","Unknown"],["1X TAE buffer (0.04 M Tris-acetate, 0.002 M EDTA)","125 ml/gel","Variable","NA","Unknown"],["GelRed Nucleic Acid Gel Stain 10,000X","12.5 Âµl/gel","Biotium","https://biotium.com/product/gelred-nucleic-acid-gel-stain/","Unknown"],["6X gel loading dye","Variable","Variable","NA","Unknown"],["100 base pair DNA ladder","10 Âµl/gel","Variable","NA","Unknown"]],"guid":"024BAAA025AC11EEA7F38338F0D8840F","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Agarose","1.9 g/gel","Variable","NA","Unknown"],["1X TAE buffer (0.04 M Tris-acetate, 0.002 M EDTA)","125 ml/gel","Variable","NA","Unknown"],["GelRed Nucleic Acid Gel Stain 10,000X","12.5 Âµl/gel","Biotium","https://biotium.com/product/gelred-nucleic-acid-gel-stain/","Unknown"],["6X gel loading dye","Variable","Variable","NA","Unknown"],["100 base pair DNA ladder","10 Âµl/gel","Variable","NA","Unknown"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}},"5":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"918qk","text":"Working stock of 1X TAE buffer made from 980 mL DI water + 20 mL 50x TAE","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"epi1u","text":"Wipe down 10 ÂµL pipette with 70% ethanol and RNase Away. UV for 10 minutes on each side","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eii8u","text":"Wipe down a staging area near the PCR hood with 10% bleach, 70% ethanol, and RNase Away","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7csh4","text":"Wipe down ice bin with 10% bleach, 70% ethanol, and RNase away, fill with ice, and remove DNA samples, PCR-grade water, Qiagen Multiplex Mix, and primers from the freezer to thaw. Place bin in staging area near PCR hood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brejq","text":"Clean inside of PCR hood (including tube racks, etc.) with 10% bleach, 70% ethanol, and RNase Away","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4ahb6","text":"Wipe down PCR hood pipettes with 70% ethanol and RNase Away","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aoghc","text":"Clean any items that need to go into the PCR hood and can be UVed with 10% bleach, 70% ethanol, and RNase Away and then place into PCR hood, including:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6d0o","text":" Lab marker","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22df5","text":"Bag of 8-well tube strips","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6i92g","text":"Bag of microcentrifuge tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34b4n","text":"Strip tube holder","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3d1ud","text":"Any new tip boxes (make sure you have enough in the hood for the rest of the protocol)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7lc26","text":"With PCR hood cover in place, run UV light for 10 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7u9kd","text":"While PCR hood is UVing, wipe down a vortex, centrifuge, work bench, and box of 10 ÂµL pipette tips with 10% bleach, 70% ethanol, and RNase Away","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5lo91","text":"Once UV timer on PCR hood is done, remove the cover and turn on the regular light","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1kacf","text":"Once reagents have thawed, gently vortex and wipe down the tubes with RNase Away before bringing into the hood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ng06","text":"Place a Kimwipe dampened with RNase Away just outside the hood to clean tubes you bring in and out of the hood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"43a8l","text":"Set up your diagram of how you're organizing your samples and calculate the total amount of PCR reagents needed for all samples, e.g. using the attached Sample PCR Calculation Spreadsheet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7q8m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"870ft","text":"Change gloves before beginning to work in the hood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pelo","text":" Label tube strips with relevant information, including:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l0ea","text":"Tube number","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66biu","text":"Initials","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4eijb","text":"Date","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"99ocq","text":"Add primers and PCR-grade water to microcentrifuge tube(s) according to your combined reagent recipe (see attached Sample PCR Calculation Spreadsheet), remove from hood, vortex vigorously, wipe with RNase Away, and return to hood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ho42","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4v4rr","text":"Add Qiagen Multiplex Mix to microcentrifuge tube(s) according to your master mix recipe, remove from hood, vortex VERY gently, wipe with RNase Away, and return to hood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g7ea","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"79pf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dev1c","text":"Taq Polymerase does not like to be heavily vortexed","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"df0c3","text":"Using a pipette, aliquot 24 ÂµL of master mix to each strip tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39u4n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fa7sj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"avnf8","text":"The amount, 24 ÂµL, should be the final volume per reaction minus the amount of DNA template. You can reuse your tips unless you think you contaminated the tips.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ccmfs","text":"Remove the aliquoted master mix and put on bench","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9b8jg","text":"Vortex each DNA sample and pipette 1 ÂµL into the appropriate tube strip. Mix the DNA and master mix solution by pipetting up and down","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ps2d","text":"Turn on thermocycler and select your program. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jb5a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fei84","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b0u3l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"952pp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8B324140259711EEA7F38338F0D8840F","height":237,"id":394219,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"4e78p\",\"text\":\"PCR cycling adapted from Curd et al. 2019\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"italic\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":41}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screenshot 2023-07-18 at 11.18.36 AM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/na9pb4cip.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/na9mb4cip.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/na9nb4cip.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/na9kb4cip.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b4fd7","text":"Even once you've programmed your thermocycler settings, always check the program before using. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ukvn","text":"Place your samples in to the thermocycler, and double check that all tubes are fully sealed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"28abg","text":"The thermocycler will take between 2 and 4 hours to complete the program. While the thermocycler is running, prepare for gel electrophoresis (below)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8n4nf","text":"When the thermocycler has finished running, remove your tubes and turn off thermocycler","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7oie","text":"Spin your PCR tubes down using a centrifuge or microcentrifuge specialized for plates or tubes and label. Make sure the labels are clear. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5v74","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9uufs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":76,"style":"sup"},{"length":2,"offset":144,"style":"sup"}],"key":"9sloa","text":"If you will use your PCR products within 1 week, it is safe to store it at 4oC. If it will be more than 1 week, store your PCR products in a -20 oC freezer to avoid DNA degradation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a89h3","text":"Weigh out 1.9 g of agarose and measure out 125 ml of 1X TAE for a 1.5% gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5c4rm","text":"Heat agarose in TAE in microwave until the agar is completely dissolved. You will know the agarose is completely dissolved when there are no specks floating in the TAE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2m519","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"38hdl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1q65r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d2big","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"570lt","text":"Be careful of boil-over as it occurs quickly and unexpectedly. Recommend heating for ~30 seconds at a time and swirling in between.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"drgn6","text":"Use a paper towel or hot-pad to hold the beaker as it will be very hot.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rdnf","text":"Allow the solution to cool to just above room temperature.  Placing the flask on a few folded paper towels will prevent the agarose on the bottom from solidifying too soon.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"661tu","text":"Once cool, add 12.5 ul of GelRed per 125 mL of gel (want it to be 1X final concentration). Gently swirl until GelRed is dissipated evenly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4v33j","text":"Fit the casting tray in the box","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80c3v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ei1ri","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9tf6s","text":"Make sure the casting tray is oriented so that the solution does not run off. Also make sure that the rubber gasket is seated properly so that the casting tray does not leak.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5lqu5","text":"Pour the agarose into the casting tray and place the combs in the tray. Use the âfatterâ side of the combs to make it easier to pipet into.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e36bt","text":"Allow the gel to solidify","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cja3s","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cgoa0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"666vs","text":"Gel is cool when it is a uniform milky white color. If the center looks clear still, it needs more time to solidify. It usually needs to cool for ~15-20 minutes.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7l96h","text":"Remove the tray and put in running position with the combs closer to the negative (black) electrode","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8foga","text":"Fill the box with TAE buffer until it just covers the gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9s20r","text":"Carefully remove the combs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcjon","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e00u8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fbgv4","text":"At this point, you can store the gel for later if needed. Fill a shallow container (e.g,. Tupperware) with enough 1X TAE to cover the gel. Carefully slide the gel out of the casting tray into the TAE. Cover with tin foil and store at 4Â°C.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3mrd7","text":"Load 5 Âµl of DNA ladder (at concentrations specified by the manufacturer) into the wells on either end of the row of samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ff8dt","text":"Dot 2 Âµl of loading dye (one dot per PCR product) onto a piece of parafilm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32gqf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e6esd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eeh04","text":"If you have a large number of samples it can be easier to do this in a 96-well plate using a 12-channel pipetter.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9hne","text":"Mix 4 Âµl of PCR product with the dye by pipetting up and down","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bbv0c","text":"Load the entire ~6 Âµl sample into a well, ejecting the sample slowly and carefully to avoid spillage or bubbles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlb3n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"euab1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"et0j8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"26nq5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4qqdl","text":"If there are any air bubbles in the wells, remove them with a pipet tip before loading sample into the well.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"37kgk","text":"Insert only the tip of the pipet tip into the well so you donât pierce the bottom of the gel.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3k9pj","text":"Run gel at 110 volts for 60 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31afc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1jcqv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"12jdi","text":"These parameters can be adjusted for various applications, i.e. longer running times at lower voltages for better separation of many products and/or long amplicons (\u003e1 kb).  Similarly, shorter running times and higher voltages (up to 120V) can be used if youâre in a big hurry, but itâs not ideal and can result in smearing.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6hu16","text":"Decide the subset of samples to visualize via gel electrophoresis to confirm successful amplification","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6d1hd","text":"Visualize and photograph gel using UV light box, GelDoc, etc","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8ueqp","text":"If visualizing with GelDoc, use the following steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eq1ri","text":"Use a paper towel to open the drawer of the GelDoc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6r7k7","text":"Remove the tray from the gel box and carefully slide the gel onto the glass surface of the drawer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"51n9h","text":"Remove one glove, close the drawer and open the main door of the GelDoc. Open the QuantityOne software and select File -\u003e GelDoc XR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"docq1","text":"Turn on the white lamp by pressing the Epi White button and click âLive/Focusâ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fq53v","text":"Use your gloved hand to center the gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t3lv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"lrbb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9jj2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c62u1","text":"You can put a KimWipe along the edge of the gel if it is sliding too much on the glass.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b7kho","text":"Close the door and turn on the UV lamp (Trans UV button)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6qvrl","text":"Take a picture by clicking either âAuto Exposeâ or âManual Acquireâ, then âFreezeâ. Adjust the exposure length as necessary until you are satisfied with the image.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3q7qc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8d8kf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7u9t3","text":"The brightness of the bands will decrease the longer they are exposed to UV, so keep the lamp on for as little time as possible.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4im97","text":"Click âSave,â then âPrint.â","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qsna","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7uo2c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":69,"offset":214}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dl77","text":"The software has a number of really useful features (via âAnalyzeâ) for processing and analyzing the image, which is really helpful if you are doing DNA fingerprinting, multiplex PCR, etc. These can be explored at http://www.bio-rad.com/webroot/web/pdf/lsr/literature/4000126-14A.pdf","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"AB9EAAE230AA11EEB98FA34DCE2318F3","url":"http://www.bio-rad.com/webroot/web/pdf/lsr/literature/4000126-14A.pdf"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9f5gf","text":"Dispose of the gel properly and clean the glass surface of the GelDoc with a paper towel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Environmental DNA (eDNA) COI PCR Amplification and Gel Electrophoresis Protocol
title_html: Environmental DNA (eDNA) COI PCR Amplification and Gel Electrophoresis Protocol

versions.title: Environmental DNA (eDNA) COI PCR Amplification and Gel Electrophoresis Protocol
versions.title_html: Environmental DNA (eDNA) COI PCR Amplification and Gel Electrophoresis Protocol
